verses.text: My son, if thou wilt receive my words, And hide my commandments with thee;
So that \add thou\add* incline thine ear unto wisdom, \add And\add* apply thine heart to understanding;
Yea, if thou criest after knowledge, \add And\add* liftest up thy voice for understanding;
If thou seekest her as silver, And searchest for her as \add for\add* hid treasures;
Then shalt thou understand the fear of the \sc Lord\sc*, And find the knowledge of God.
For the \sc Lord\sc* giveth wisdom: Out of his mouth \add cometh\add* knowledge and understanding.
He layeth up sound wisdom for the righteous: \add He is\add* a buckler to them that walk uprightly.
\add He\add* keepeth the paths of judgment, And preserveth the way of his saints.
Then shalt thou understand righteousness, and judgment, And equity; \add yea\add*, every good path.
When wisdom entereth into thine heart, And knowledge is pleasant unto thy soul;
Discretion shall preserve thee, Understanding shall keep thee:
To deliver thee from the way of the evil \add man\add*, From the man that speaketh froward things;
Who leave the paths of uprightness, To walk in the ways of darkness;
Who rejoice to do evil, \add And\add* delight in the frowardness of the wicked;
Whose ways \add are\add* crooked, And \add they\add* froward in their paths:
To deliver thee from the strange woman, \add Even\add* from the stranger \add which\add* flattereth with her words;
Which forsaketh the guide of her youth, And forgetteth the covenant of her God.
For her house inclineth unto death, And her paths unto the dead.
None that go \add unto\add* her return \add again\add*, Neither take they hold of the paths of life.
That thou mayest walk in the way of good \add men\add*, And keep the paths of the righteous.
For the upright shall dwell \add in\add* the land, And the perfect shall remain in it.
But the wicked shall be cut off from the earth, And the transgressors shall be rooted out of it.
